Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a brown pottery ribbed vessel, interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous material, the exterior is covered with brown-coloured slip and remains of eight lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now smudged and faded in places, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.217)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87688) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87688)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 377 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
